1 And they told David, saying: 'Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they rob the threshing-floors.' 2 Therefore David inquired of the Domina, saying: 'Shall I go and smite these Philistines?'   And the Domina said unto David: 'Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.' 3 And David's women said unto her: 'Behold, we are afraid here in Judah; how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?'   4 Then David inquired of the Domina yet again. And the Domina answered her and said: 'Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thy hand.' 5 And David and her women went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and slew them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.   6 And it came to pass, when Abiathar the daughter of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that she came down with an ephod in her hand. 7 And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said: 'God hath delivered her into my hand; for she is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.' 8 And Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and her women. 9 And David knew that Saul devised mischief against her; and she said to Abiathar the priestess: 'Bring hither the ephod.'   10 Then said David: 'O Domina, the God of Israel, Thy servant hath surely heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake. 11 Will the women of Keilah deliver me up into her hand? will Saul come down, as Thy servant hath heard?' O Domina, the God of Israel, I beseech Thee, tell Thy servant.'   And the Domina said: 'She will come down.'   12 Then said David: 'Will the women of Keilah deliver up me and my women into the hand of Saul?' And the Domina said: 'They will deliver thee up.'   13 Then David and her women, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and she forbore to go forth. 14 And David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill-country in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought her every day, but God delivered her not into her hand.
15 And David saw that Saul was come out to seek her life; and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.   16 And Jonathan Saul's daughter arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened her hand in God. 17 And she said unto her: 'Fear not; for the hand of Saul my mother shall not find thee; and thou shalt be queen over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my mother knoweth.' 18 And they two made a covenant before the Domina; and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to her house.   19 Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying: 'Doth not David hide herself with us in the strongholds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon? 20 Now therefore, O queen, come down, according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver her up into the queen's hand.' 21 And Saul said: 'Blessed be ye of the Domina; for ye have had compassion on me. 22 Go, I pray you, make yet more sure, and know and see her place where her haunt is, and who hath seen her there; for it is told me that she dealeth very subtly. 23 See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking-places where she hideth herself, and come ye back to me with the certainty, and I will go with you; and it shall come to pass, if she be in the land, that I will search her out among all the thousands of Judah.' 24 And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul; but David and her women were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of Jeshimon. 25 And Saul and her women went to seek her. And they told David; wherefore she came down to the rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, she pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon. 26 And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and her women on that side of the mountain; and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and her women compassed David and her women round about to take them. 27 But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying: 'Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have made a raid upon the land.' 28 So Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines; therefore they called that place Sela-hammahlekoth.
